question: In 2003, Morocco made the highly unusual offer to send 2,000 _____ to assist the United States' war efforts in Iraq.?
While president of the United States, John Adams had a dog named Juno and a dog named _____.?
The inventor of the laxative Ex-Lax has the unusual name Max _____.?
Ben and Jerry only started making ice cream because it was too expensive to make _____.?
Huggies Brazil developed a phone app that tells you when a baby's diaper is wet. It's called _____.?
In 1976 boxing legend Muhammad Ali released an education children's album titled 'Ali and His Gang Vs. Mr. _____.'?
During a famous fire in 1567, a Norwegian man named Hans Steininger died after tripping over a _____.?
The sound of E.T. walking was made by someone squishing _____.?
In the video game, The Sims, they speak _____.
Marcella Hazan is the culinary guru who pioneered the unusual technique of cooking duck with a _____.?
A woman in Muncie, Indiana was hospitalized after trying to remove a callus on her foot with a _____.?
A study published in the journal Anthrozoo reported that cows produce 5% more milk when they are given _____.?
